holidays.name: Valentine’s Day
holidays.description: The classic day to celebrate love and affection between intimate partners with cards, chocolates, flowers, and romantic gestures.
holidays.origin: Rooted in ancient Roman and Christian traditions, Valentine’s Day honors Saint Valentine, who was associated with courtly love and secrecy.
holidays.funFact: The first Valentine’s card was sent in the 15th century by Charles, Duke of Orleans, to his wife from prison! The tradition of giving chocolates started after Richard Cadbury created a heart-shaped box in the late 1800s.

holidays.name: National Donor Day
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness about organ, eye, tissue, bone marrow, and blood donation, encouraging people to save lives through generous donations.
holidays.origin: Established in 1998, this American observance honors donors and encourages everyone to register as donors.
holidays.funFact: One organ donor can save up to 8 lives, but one blood donation can save up to 3 lives!

holidays.name: Ferris Wheel Day
holidays.description: A fun tribute to the iconic amusement ride invented on February 14, 1893, celebrating thrill, engineering marvels, and spectacular views.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the opening day of the original Ferris Wheel at the 1893 World’s Columbian Exposition in Chicago.
holidays.funFact: The original Ferris Wheel was 264 feet tall—taller than the Statue of Liberty! It took 12 million board feet of lumber and 2,500 tons of steel to build.

holidays.name: International Book Giving Day
holidays.description: An unofficial holiday encouraging people to give books to children to promote literacy and a lifelong love of reading.
holidays.origin: Started in 2012 by book lovers who wanted to make reading accessible and fun for kids worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Millions of books are donated every year on this day, often in surprising and touching ways, from leaving books in laundromats to gifting them in hospitals.

holidays.name: National Condom Day
holidays.description: A cheeky and important awareness day aimed at promoting safe sex and sexual health by highlighting condom use.
holidays.origin: Has been celebrated unofficially for decades, often with humorous and educational events, especially on a day known for romance.
holidays.funFact: More condoms are sold on February 14 than on any other day of the year!
